title: What is the first living organism found without oxygen? - Quora

response.answer_text: [1] It is not easy to believe but it is now confirmed although accidentally that Henneguya Salminicola is the first living animal that can live without oxygen. Weird but true.  Proceedings of the National Academy of Sciences of the United States of America aka PNAS published on Feb 24, 2020, that they have found the evidence of an animal that has lost its mitochondrial genome. Although the cells of this myxozoan retained the mitochondrial related organelles but have lost the genes associated with aerobic respiration and mitochondrial genome replication. A team of researchers led by Dayana Yahalomi of Tel Aviv University in Israel finds out the organism, which is a fewer-than 10-celled microscopic parasite who lives in Salmon fish muscles. A close study of H. Salminicola or Henneguya Zschokkei using deep sequencing and fluorescence microscopy led the scientists found that it has lost its mitochondrial genome but it is still a mystery how it is surviving without aerobic respiration. Due to the above discovery, the theory of evolution is again in the discussion. Footnotes[1] FRIDGE OF FACTS

ऑक्सीजन के बिना जीने वाला पहला जीव मिला वैज्ञानिक को जेलफिश में हेनेगुया सल्सिनिसिको ला नाम का एक परजीवी मिला है,जिसमे माइटोकॉर्डियल जीनोम मौजूद नही है । हम लोग कई बार अपनी सांसे रोकने की कोशिश करते है लेकिन हमसे ज्यादा देर तक उसे रोक नही सकते है अपनी सांसे ओर हमे सांस लेना ही पड़ता है आपने जीवन मे बिना सांस लेने की कल्पना भी नही की होगी लेकिन कुदरत का खेल ही अलग है बिना ऑक्सीजन के भी दुनिया मे जीव है ।
